P1 played red 2//Card to play on: red 2//Player 2 Contents of hand: blue 3, green 3, green +2, red 9, red +2//P2: The cards you can play are: red 9 and red +2.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? P2 played red 9//Card to play on: red 9//Player 1 Contents of hand: blue 1, blue 3, green 3, green 5, red 5//P1: The only card you can play is: red 5.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? P1 played red 5//Card to play on: red 5//Player 2 Contents of hand: blue 3, green 3, green +2, red +2//P2: The only card you can play is: red +2.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? P2 played red +2//Card to play on: red +2//Player 1 Contents of hand: blue 1, blue 3, green 3, green 5//P1: Automatically drew 2 cards, given no other option.//Card to play on: red +2//Player 2 Contents of hand: blue 3, green 3, green +2//P2: The only card you can play is: green +2.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? P2 played green +2//Card to play on: green +2//Player 1 Contents of hand: blue 1, blue 3, blue 8, green 3, green 5, red skip//P1: Automatically drew 2 cards, given no other option.//Card to play on: green +2//Player 2 Contents of hand: blue 3, green 3//P2: The only card you can play is: green 3.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? P2 played green 3//Card to play on: green 3//Player 1 Contents of hand: blue 1, blue 3, blue 8, green 3, green 5, red 3, red skip, yellow 3//P1: The cards you can play are: blue 3, green 3, green 5, red 3, and yellow 3.//Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card? "" is not a valid choice. Use either the first letter or the whole word of the command you want to run. Will you (d)raw or (p)lay a card?
